title: Hormone Levels
content: rT3 is telling you how much peripheral T4 is converting to rT3, which opposes T3. Each of those have a completely different cause. Sex hormones include DHEA (dehydroepiandrosterone), FSH (follicle stimulating hormone), LH (luteinizing hormone), DHT (dihydrotestosterone), Progesterone, SHBG (sex hormone binding globulin), Estrogen (estrone [E1], estradiol [E2], estriol [E3]).

title: Omega-3s
content: Omega-3s include EPA (eicosapentaenoic acid) & DHA (docosahexaenoic acid). It is preferred to see EPA/DHA index above 8.5. For some patients, you want to see DHA higher than the EPA. What you’re optimizing for: neurodegenerative (DHA) or atherosclerosis (EPA is more important).

title: Cholesterol Synthesis and Absorption Biomarkers
content: Cholesterol synthesis and absorption biomarkers include Desmosterol (synthesis), Campesterol, sitosterol, cholestanol (absorption). There is concern about oversuppression of cholesterol synthesis at the individual level.

title: IGF-1 (Insulin-like Growth Factor 1)
content: It’s likely that cycling between low and high levels of IGF-1 is optimal. Fasting can dramatically lower IGF-1. Three things that impact IGF-1 most are Amino acid intake (methionine), Insulin levels (largely dietary carbs), Exogenous hormones (e.g., growth hormone, an analog of the human pituitary gland to make more IGF-1).

title: Women's Health
content: Most important distinction in women's health is sex hormones. Women, during reproductive years, menstrual cycle experiencing profound fluctuations in hormones. Losing estrogen, progesterone and testosterone. In menopause all the hormones kind of stop suddenly. Women get less cardiovascular disease, more Alzheimer’s disease, less cancer in the US and live longer than men.

title: Fasting and Ketosis for Females
content: Women need to be thoughtful about a couple things: Fertility issues, or trying to get pregnant, can’t make a compelling case that a woman should be in nutritional ketosis. It’s certainly possible to get pregnant in ketosis but the question is how are you optimizing? The other part of this is should women who are pregnant be in ketosis? Clearly evolved to be able to handle this, however, is it optimal?

title: Blood Glucose Monitor
content: Regarding hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c): “Directionally tolerable but mostly shit”. He knows bc he’s used CGM in so many patients and compared reports to A1c and you realize that A1c is at the mercy of the fact that a red blood cell lives for 90-120 days.

title: Lithium Supplementation
content: Peter says that the evidence that groundwater containing higher levels of lithium is contributing to better mental health is as good as any such data can be which is to say “not great”. Peter experimented on himself to see if taking lithium would stabilize his mood. Peter now takes low dose 10-20 mg lithium. He categorizes this as “probably not harmful, [but] not sure how much value I’m getting out of it”.

title: Berberine and its Health Effects
content: Berberine, a plant-derived extract has two properties. First, it is a weak activator of AMP kinase, similar to Metformin. The net effect is decreasing hepatic glucose output. Secondly, it is a weak inhibitor of the enzyme, PCSK9. It probably only works in a subset of people who overexpress PCSK9, which ends up in higher LDL-P. These patients respond well to berberine.

title: Aspirin and Heart Disease
content: Baby aspirin has some effect on inflammation, but the majority of the benefit is on platelets, therefore reducing thrombotic events (blood clot), which can be the final moment where you have a heart attack. There are side effects to be considered, easier bruising, bleeding, a small risk of ulcer, etc. A study that came out recently that looked at relatively low-risk populations, found that the risk of taking baby aspirin was small, but so was the benefit.

title: HR Variability and Health
content: HRV measures the specific changes in time (i.e., variability) between successive heartbeats. The raw measurement is the interbeat interval (IBI): IBI is used in reference to the time interval between individual beats of the heart. HRV with temperature and movement feeds an algorithm in Oura that predicts sleep quality. Real-time feedback and 'readiness' score are valuable about knowing HRV.

title: Fasting and Sleep
content: Fasting affects sleep and the biggest thing was deep sleep (stage 3 and 4) went up the most. Light slight (stage 1 and 2) went down the most. REM was unchanged. HRV was higher. Resting HR was on par with what it is if you’re not eating and drinking before bed. Respiratory Rate went down.

title: Saturated Fat and Health
content: The case for saturated fat may be overstated, the view that it is never harmful and eating 90% of saturated fat can’t be healthy for everyone. Rather than rely on some study, it is suggested that we learn to understand what the biomarkers are that changes as a result of consuming saturated fat, meaning inflammation, lipoproteins, and lipids.

title: Nicotinamide Riboside Supplementation for Longevity
content: Cells need NAD, so you could argue having more NAD in a cell is a better thing. But cells cannot take up NAD, a cell has to be able to make its own. With that said, giving precursors is an interesting idea. Based on data, only way to increase cellular NAD would be intravenous doses of NR or NMN. Taking it orally is probably not harmful, but probably waste of money.

title: Supplements and Health
content: Companies relied on for a variety of supplements include Jarrow, Pure Encapsulations, Nordic Naturals, Carlson Labs and Thorne for Berberine.

title: Online Forum for Doctor-Patient Matchmaking
content: An online forum that can act as a matchmaking service between doctors and patients is being considered. This would allow patients to submit questions and give doctors an opportunity to answer the questions and provide info as to how patients can reach them.

title: Qualities Desired in a Doctor
content: People often seek a doctor who is comprehensive, deliberate, and thoughtful, and who has a similar objective, strategy, and tactics approach.

title: Experience in Medical ICU
content: The medical ICU (MICU) at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) cares for patients with a wide variety of serious medical illnesses from sepsis to pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome to multiple organ failure. The depth and level of obsession that’s required in an ICU, and the collective knowledge and sharing ideas, the intervention and feedback loops, are crucial for patient care.

title: Latest on APOE4
content: For the latest on ApoE, check out a previous episode of The Drive with a neurologist at Cornell who runs the largest Alzheimer’s Prevention Clinic in the world. The APOE4.info site and forum is also a great resource for APOE4.
